metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4458 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the getaddrinfo function insysdeps/posix/getaddrinfo.c in GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.18 andearlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a(1) hostname or (2) IP address that triggers a large number of AF_INET6address results. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incompletefix for CVE-2013-1914.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4458` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-armel - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-pic - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-ppc64 - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-xen - 2.18-0ubuntu1
multiarch-support - 2.18-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.18-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18-0ubuntu1').
